awd_titl_txt: Improved Isotope Generator for Cardiac Imaging
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal suggests a very novel approach to producing                       radioisotopes for use in non-invasive diagnosis and assessment of               heart disease.  The short life isotope will be continuously                     separated from the long live isotope by the chromatography                      technique.  Thus, the patient will receive primarily the short                  life isotope.  The radiation dose and the time over which the                   patient is exposed to radiation will be greatly shortened.  The                 background radiation will not increase significantly due the                    short half-life of the radioisotope.  Therefore, the various                    medical techniques using radioisotopes can be used repeatedly                   without the background radiation creating noise that will degrade               further testing using radioisotopes.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
